title: Street Cleaning Operator
description:
Competition #21/78

Internal/External Posting

Closing date: May 20, 2021  

 

Street Cleaning Operator (Temporary – up to 6 months)

Engineering and Public Works Department

 

 

POSITION FUNCTION

Operate a variety of street cleaning equipment and trucks for the purpose of cleaning sidewalks and streets and collecting / disposing of refuse.

 

KEY DUTIES

Operate street cleaning equipment such as sidewalk sweepers and trucks for cleaning city streets, sidewalks and bus shelters; operate a crane to empty litter receptacles; operate refuse packers following prescribed route to remove and dispose of refuse; shovel and load debris from sweepers.

 

Operate various hand and power equipment such as power washers, back pack blowers, brooms and rakes to clean sidewalks; remove graffiti from public areas using various cleaners and chemicals; remove and replace damaged concrete litter tubs; remove snow and ice accumulations by shovelling or applying chemical ice melter as required.

 

Perform minor maintenance such as cleaning and washing inside and outside of equipment and vehicles; carry out pre and post-trip inspections by checking items according to standard job procedures such as fluid levels, belts, hoses and lights; report all repairs needed and damage to supervisor and mechanic shop; check first aid and safety equipment; complete daily equipment log and time sheet.

 

Respond to unscheduled or emergency calls such as gravel, cement or oil spills; pick up dead animals on roads or beaches; assist with traffic control as required.

 

Notify various sections of damage to City property such as pot holes, broken castings and sign or meter posts and graffiti; maintain a record of all areas swept on a master street map.

 

Perform related duties where qualified.

 

INDEPENDENCE

Work is performed according to a scheduled route or is assigned by supervisor.

Problems such as changes to the route or priority of assignments are referred to supervisor.

 

WORKING CONDITIONS

Physical Effort:

Lift and move heavy materials and equipment. (often)

Sit in awkward positions while operation equipment. (often)

Confined to cab of vehicle. (frequent)

Mental Effort:

Short periods of intense concentration while operating equipment and manoeuvring vehicles. (frequent)

Visual/Auditory Effort:

Normal.

Work Environment:

Work outside in all weather conditions. (frequent)

Exposure to potentially abusive people. (frequent)

Work in close proximity to moving traffic. (occasional)

Exposure to unpleasant odours, dust, noise, waste products and potentially hazardous materials. (frequent)

 

KEY SKILLS AND ABILITIES

Operate street cleaning equipment such as sidewalk sweepers; packers, pressure washer; single axle trucks and small hand equipment.

Complete forms accurately.

Establish and maintain effective working relationships.

Deal with the public in a courteous and tactful manner.

Work and operate equipment safely.

 

QUALIFICATIONS

Formal Education, Training and Occupational Certification:

Grade 10.

Current and valid Class 5 B.C. Driver's Licence.

Experience:

2 years of related experience.

or an equivalent combination of education and experience.

 

OTHER:

May be requested to substitute in a more senior position.

 

 

Work schedule: Various shifts, 40hrs/week

$29.35 per hour, Pay Grade 5 

Job Code # 645

This is a CUPE Local 50 Position

 

To apply for this opportunity you will need to create an online profile or log back in to our career portal at www.victoria.ca/jobs - only online submission will be considered. All applications must be submitted online by 4:30 pm on the closing date noted on the posting. Please be prepared to provide proof of qualifications and supporting materials as outlined in your resume

 

City of Victoria is an equal opportunity employer committed to establishing an inclusive, equitable, and accessible environment for all. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, age, sex, religion, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status or any other basis protected by applicable law. 

We are committed to ensuring that reasonable accommodations are made available to persons with disabilities during the recruitment cycle and will provide reasonable accommodations upon request.  If you require assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please email us at

HR@victoria.ca

title: Automotive Detailer - Car Washer - London
description:
Overview:

Enterprise Holdings is seeking a responsible, dedicated person to join our team as a full time Automotive Detailer. This position pays $15.50 / hour and is located at 1750 CRUMLIN ROAD
LONDON, ON N5V 3B6

 

We offer:

  • Paid time off
  • Employee discount
  • Retirement savings plan
  • Extended Health Benefits (Medical, Prescrption Drug, Dental and Vision)
  • Life Insurance
  • Training and development


Schedule:

  • Monday: 9:00am - 5:00pm
  • Wednesday: 9:00am - 4:00pm  
  • Friday: 9:00am - 5:00pm
  • Saturday: 9:00am - 5:00pm

Enterprise Holdings operates the National, Enterprise, and Alamo car rental brands and has frequently been named one of the top places to work.   Enterprise Holdings is the largest and fastest growing privately owned automotive rental and leasing company in the  North America.  

 

The Automotive Detailer is responsible for cleaning, sanitizing, inspecting, and preparing vehicles in accordance with our Complete Clean Pledge to ensure that all vehicles rented from the branch are safe and clean.

 

As you are considering a position with Enterprise Holdings, we invite you to learn more about our business. Today â€“ and every day â€“ the safety and wellbeing of employees, customers and the communities we serve is our top priority. For the latest on our COVID-19 response, and for more information on our Complete Clean Pledge,  please click here.

 

Responsibilities:

We are hiring now for immediate openings.   Responsibilities include:

  • Clean and sanitize vehicle interior per Complete Clean Pledge standards
  • Vacuum and prepare vehicle interior per Complete Clean Pledge standards
  • Wash, clean and dry the vehicle's exterior - this might include cars of different sizes, as well as vans and trucks.
  • Check fuel level and warning lights: inspect windshield for damage; factory reset/restore vehicle setting to clear prior customer data; check for customer items and place anything of value in Lost & Found; verify that registration is present, current and matches the license plate.
  • Check fluid levels and add as needed; check tire condition, pressure and tread depth; inspect vehicle exterior for damage
  • Fuel and stage vehicle
  • Inspect vehicle for any safety concerns; report any warning lights and/or vehicle/windshield/tire damage; pull vehicle out of the prep processing as necessary
  • Maintains a clean and orderly work area and report any unsafe or hazardous conditions
  • Responsible for wearing proper personal protection equipment (PPE) and ensuring cleaning, detailing, washing and sanitization supplies are available
  • Assists customers when needed. May transport customers to and from the branches
  • Helps maintain overall site appearance including general cleaning of interior and exteriors of branch locations
  • Site appearance responsibilities to include: desktops, countertops, phones, floors, trash, bathrooms, vacuuming, sweeping the lot and any other miscellaneous tasks related to the daily cleanliness of the branch location

Additional Responsibilities

  • Seek to improve job performance through self-assessment, skill development, training and goal setting
  • Maintain a regular and reliable level of attendance and punctuality
  • Perform miscellaneous job-related duties as assigned
Qualifications:
  • Must be at least 18 years old
  • Must have a valid driver's license with no more than 2 moving violations and/or at-fault accidents on driving record in the past  3 years
  • No drug or alcohol related conviction on driving record in the past 5 years
  • Must be authorized to work in Canada and not require work authorization sponsorship by our company for this position now or in the future.
  • Must be able to lift 25 pounds to assist customers
  • As per government mandate, all employees on-site are required to be fully vaccinated as per Vaccination Requirement, subject only to limited exceptions mandated by legislation.
  •

title: Land Lease Maintenance
description:
Ã‚  :

Are you an outdoor enthusiast and skilled in conducting general repairs?

 

Are you looking for part time seasonal employment with a residential property management company listed as one of the 50 Best Employers in Canada?

 

Summary:  

Reporting to the Operations Manager, the Land Lease Maintenance staff will work closely with the Community Manager, complete work orders, maintain grounds and participate in grounds construction activities.

 

This role is ideally suited to candidates located in or around Swift Current, SK. If you take pride in maintaining a functional, inviting, and aesthetically pleasing environment, and are able to handle multiple jobs in an organized fashion, we want to hear from you!

 

Responsibilities:

 

  • Complete all work orders as required by the Operations Manager and or Community Manager
  • Communicate work orders that cannot be completed by maintenance staff to the Community Manager
  • Perform grass cutting, pruning trees, whipper snipping and clearing catch basins and culverts
  • Pickup yard waste including waste that tenants have set out and place them at the compost area
  • General maintenance and repair of roads including patching potholes when required, sweeping and meeting with contractors
  • Perform general maintenance tasks and daily duties
  • Assist with, set up, general repairs and maintenance of Capreit owned homes
  • Distribute notices and letters to tenants as required
  • Organizing and liaising with contractors
  • Request material for the items required for work orders
  • Take water samples for testing (where applicable)
  • Take weekly chlorine residual samples for testing (where applicable)
  • Assist with other duties as required

Maintenance of Site

  • Repair and maintenance of common areas
  • General grounds keeping including mowing, pruning, whipper snipping, and clearing catch basins
  • Cleaning of vacant lots
  • Salting, sanding and snow removal (where applicable)

 

Qualifications

  • Excellent communication skills
  • General Carpentry, Plumbing or Mechanical background
  • Organized and able to handle multiple projects
  • Patience and diplomacy
  • Able to work 15-20 hours per week and on call for after hour emergencies
  • Hold a valid driver's licence and have access to a reliable vehicle

 


Your opportunity to build an exciting career!

title: Field Service Technician
description:
Are you a Road Warrior, who likes to travel throughout the Oakville Area, working independently as well as part of the team?

This is an exciting opportunity to be a part of a growing and progressive (not to mention stable!) Canadian owned and operated Manufacturer and Distributor.

The role of this opportunity is to ensure superior customer service is delivered on the road, for all equipment, by running an efficient operation of mechanical services to customers in accordance with company quality standards, programs and procedures.

The successful candidate will be responsible for troubleshooting, diagnosing and repairing various types equipment issues. This will include implementing efficient preventative maintenance programs to all machines, as required by the company, in order to ensure excellent quality and customer satisfaction.

Someone who has a good understanding of schematic drawings/blueprints, as well as being mechanically and electrically inclined is essential for this opportunity. No special tickets or designations are required, but are considered an asset.

The successful candidate will travel with a company vehicle and will travel directly from home to the client site. Gas card, 407 expenses, company credit card and more are included as well as overtime.

Candidate should have experience fixing various types of equipment including bobcats, forklifts, floor scrubbers, sweepers, vacuum cleaners, extractors, floor machines and more.


Responsibilities Include:

  • Address Customer or subcontractor needs and concerns in a timely manner.
  • Willing to travel frequently within your designated territory or outside the province (as may be required from time to time).
  • Ability to deal with a high level of stress and promptly solve problems as they arise.
  • Service equipment on site, directly at the customer location
  • Always provide courteous customer service


Requirements Include:

  • Completion of secondary school or equivalent experience
  • 3+ year’s technical experience on cleaning equipment repairs necessary
  • Technical training on cleaning equipment repairs
  • Valid G Drivers’ License
  • Good estimating skills, including the knowledge of material, labour costs, and Inventory management
  • Customer service experience
  • Excellent technical skills, ability to read schematic diagrams, read and interpret parts manuals and diagrams, as well as strong mechanical knowledge
  • Sound knowledge of the cleaning industry
  • Detail-oriented and the ability to work under pressure
  • Ability to solve problems and working with others


Required license or certification:

  • Unrestricted G license
  • Must have clean drivers abstract


Salary plus Health & Dental Benefits, Overtime, Matching RRSP Program. 
Gas card, 407 expenses, company credit card and more are included as well as overtime and from your front door!

title: Automotive Detailer - Car Washer - Edmonton Airport
description:
Overview:

Enterprise Holdings is seeking a responsible, dedicated person to join our team as a full time Automotive Detailer. This position pays $16.75 / hour.   This position located at 1, 1000 Airport Road, Leduc AB T9E 8B7.

 

Schedule:

  • Morning, Evenings & Weekends
  • This is a 4-6 month contract that will start mid-end April

 

Enterprise Holdings operates the National, Enterprise, and Alamo car rental brands and has frequently been named one of the top places to work.   Enterprise Holdings is the largest and fastest growing privately owned automotive rental and leasing company in North America.  

 

We are committed to maintaining the highest standards of cleanliness in the industry, and as an Auto Detailer and Car Washer you will be at the forefront of our Complete Clean Pledge, going above and beyond our already rigorous cleaning protocols, to protect the health and safety of all.

 

From trucks to vans to cars of all sizes you will be responsible for washing, cleaning, sanitizing, inspecting, and preparing your branch's vehicles in accordance with our Complete Clean Pledge, ensuring that all vehicles rented by our customers are safe and clean.

 

With this in mind, as you are considering a position with Enterprise Holdings, we invite you to learn more about our business. Today â€“ and every day â€“ the safety and wellbeing of employees, customers and the communities we serve is our top priority. For the latest on our COVID-19 response, and for more information on our Complete Clean Pledge,please click here.

 

Responsibilities:
  • Clean and sanitize vehicle interior per Complete Clean Pledge standards
  • Vacuum and prepare vehicle interior per Complete Clean Pledge standards
  • Wash, clean and dry the vehicle's exterior - this might include cars of different sizes, as well as vans and trucks.
  • Check fuel level and warning lights: inspect windshield for damage; factory reset/restore vehicle setting to clear prior customer data; check for customer items and place anything of value in Lost & Found; verify that registration is present, current and matches the license plate.
  • Check fluid levels and add as needed; check tire condition, pressure and tread depth; inspect vehicle exterior for damage
  • Fuel and stage vehicle
  • Inspect vehicle for any safety concerns; report any warning lights and/or vehicle/windshield/tire damage; pull vehicle out of the prep processing as necessary
  • Maintains a clean and orderly work area and report any unsafe or hazardous conditions
  • Responsible for wearing proper personal protection equipment (PPE) and ensuring cleaning, detailing, washing and sanitization supplies are available
  • Assists customers when needed. May transport customers to and from the branches
  • Helps maintain overall site appearance including general cleaning of interior and exteriors of branch locations
  • Site appearance responsibilities to include: desktops, countertops, phones, floors, trash, bathrooms, vacuuming, sweeping the lot and any other miscellaneous tasks related to the daily cleanliness of the branch location
Additional Responsibilities
  • Seek to improve job performance through self-assessment, skill development, training and goal setting
  • Maintain a regular and reliable level of attendance and punctuality
  • Perform miscellaneous job-related duties as assigned
Qualifications:
  • Must be at least 18 years old
  • Must have a valid driver's license with no more than 2 moving violations and/or at-fault accidents on driving record in the past  3 years
  • No drug or alcohol related conviction on driving record in the past 5 years
  • Must be authorized to work in Canada and not require work authorization sponsorship by our company for this position now or in the future.
  • Must be able to lift 25 pounds to assist customers
  • Airport requires employees on-site to be fully vaccinated per Airport Vaccination Requirement, subject only to limited exceptions mandated by legislation.

title: Land Lease Maintenance
description:
Are you an outdoor enthusiast and skilled in conducting general repairs?

 

Are you looking for part time seasonal employment with a residential property management company listed as one of the 50 Best Employers in Canada?

 

Summary: 

Reporting to the Operations Manager, the Land Lease Maintenance staff will work closely with the Community Manager, complete work orders, maintain grounds and participate in grounds construction activities.

 

This role is ideally suited to candidates located in or around Swift Current, SK. If you take pride in maintaining a functional, inviting, and aesthetically pleasing environment, and are able to handle multiple jobs in an organized fashion, we want to hear from you!

 

Responsibilities:

 

  • Complete all work orders as required by the Operations Manager and or Community Manager
  • Communicate work orders that cannot be completed by maintenance staff to the Community Manager
  • Perform grass cutting, pruning trees, whipper snipping and clearing catch basins and culverts
  • Pickup yard waste including waste that tenants have set out and place them at the compost area
  • General maintenance and repair of roads including patching potholes when required, sweeping and meeting with contractors
  • Perform general maintenance tasks and daily duties
  • Assist with, set up, general repairs and maintenance of Capreit owned homes
  • Distribute notices and letters to tenants as required
  • Organizing and liaising with contractors
  • Request material for the items required for work orders
  • Take water samples for testing (where applicable)
  • Take weekly chlorine residual samples for testing (where applicable)
  • Assist with other duties as required

Maintenance of Site

  • Repair and maintenance of common areas
  • General grounds keeping including mowing, pruning, whipper snipping, and clearing catch basins
  • Cleaning of vacant lots
  • Salting, sanding and snow removal (where applicable)

 

Qualifications

  • Excellent communication skills
  • General Carpentry, Plumbing or Mechanical background
  • Organized and able to handle multiple projects
  • Patience and diplomacy
  • Able to work 15-20 hours per week and on call for after hour emergencies
  • Hold a valid driver's licence and have access to a reliable vehicle

 

Your opportunity to build an exciting career!

title: Warehouse Maintenance / Cleaning Opportunity - Full Time
description:
Urgent Hiring! Calling all dedicated cleaners / maintenance job seekers we have a Maintenance Warehouse Opening in Mississauga and Brampton!

We are looking for you to get hired for one of the biggest and established warehouse facilities in Mississauga / Brampton!

Don't look further! Check out this amazing warehouse opportunity! This is a great way to earn big and start your career! The job has a lot of potential to get extended or even get hired on perm basis! Check out the details below.

You better catch this opportunity! Check out this amazing light general labour job opening for an established and famous retail stores across the country.

Are you looking to work for a large distribution centre of a well-known retailing company in Mississauga?

Jobs Available: Maintenance / Warehouse Cleaner

Sweeping, Cleaning, Mopping
Removing Stickers
Sorting (good vs damaged) items
Moderate to heavy lifting

Pay rate: $16.95/hr - 18.50/hr (weekly pay by direct deposit)


New Shifts Available:
Days: Monday-Thursday 5:00 a.m.-3:30 p.m (40 hours)
Evenings: Monday-Thursday 4:00 p.m.-2:30 a.m. (40 hours )


Job Location:
Mississauga, Airport Road, and American Drive (close to Pearson Airport, bus accessible) & Brampton (close to Bramalea City Centre)

Please call/text Mery at 437 326 6034 or email meryrose.acero@randstad.ca

We reward your commitment with a $150 weekly attendance bonus! (paid out bi-weekly, conditions apply) PLUS you may EARN $100-$150 per REFERRAL (no cap) if you BRING SOMEONE ALONG who is also looking for work!!! (Call for more details)

Advantages
- full-time ongoing
- optional medical and dental benefits available (through Sunlife Insurance)
- weekly pay (every Thursday)
- afternoon and night shift premium
- bus route accessible
- potential for permanent hire
- opportunities for advancement

Responsibilities
- ticketing, packaging, shipping, receiving, sorting, cleaning, maintenance
- lifting 30-50 lbs
- all other duties as assigned

Qualifications
- no previous work experience required
- no minimum educational requirements
- must be able to work full time
- ability to lift up 50 lbs
- this role is conditional on clear criminal backcheck (processed by Randstad)


Summary
Please call/text 437 326 6034 or email meryrose.acero@randstad.ca

Don't Delay, Start Working NOW and earn your WEEKLY BONUS of $150!!!

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to

accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Land Lease Maintenance
description:
Are you an outdoor enthusiast and skilled in conducting general repairs?

 

Are you looking to join a residential property management company listed as one of the 50 Best Employers in Canada?

 

Summary: 

Reporting to the Operations Manager, the Land Lease Maintenance staff will work closely with the Community Manager, complete work orders, maintain grounds and participate in grounds construction activities.

 

This role is ideally suited to candidates located in or around Lincoln, NB, to travel to communities nearby. If you take pride in maintaining a functional, inviting, and aesthetically pleasing environment, have access to a reliable vehicle and are able to handle multiple jobs in an organized fashion, we want to hear from you!

 

Responsibilities:

 

  • Complete all work orders as required by the Operations Manager and or Community Manager
  • Communicate work orders that cannot be completed by maintenance staff to the Community Manager
  • Perform grass cutting, pruning trees, whipper snipping and clearing catch basins and culverts
  • Pickup yard waste including waste that tenants have set out and place them at the compost area
  • General maintenance and repair of roads including patching potholes when required, sweeping and meeting with contractors
  • Perform general maintenance tasks and daily duties
  • Assist with, set up, general repairs and maintenance of Capreit owned homes
  • Distribute notices and letters to tenants as required
  • Organizing and liaising with contractors
  • Request material for the items required for work orders
  • Take water samples for testing (where applicable)
  • Take weekly chlorine residual samples for testing (where applicable)
  • Assist with other duties as required

Maintenance of Site

  • Repair and maintenance of common areas
  • General grounds keeping including mowing, pruning, whipper snipping, and clearing catch basins
  • Cleaning of vacant lots
  • Salting, sanding and snow removal (where applicable)

 

Qualifications

  • Excellent communication skills.
  • General Carpentry, Plumbing or Mechanical background.
  • Organized and able to handle multiple projects.
  • Patience and diplomacy
  • Able to work flexible hours and have access to a reliable vehicle.
  • On call for after hour emergencies.

At CAPREIT, we reward all permanent full-time employees:

  • Competitive Base Salary
  • Paid Vacation
  • Flexible Health, Dental & Vision Benefits
  • Employee Savings Plan
  • Employee & Family Assistance Plan
  • Learning & Professional Development

 

Your opportunity to build an exciting career!

title: Automotive Detailer - Car Washer - Kelowna
description:
Overview:

Enterprise Holdings is seeking a responsible, dedicated person to join our team as a full time Automotive Detailer.   This position pays $18.25 /hour and is located at 1517 Keehn Road, Kelowna B.C. V1X 5T5.

 

We offer:

  • Paid time off
  • Employee discount
  • Retirement savings plan
  • Extended Health Benefits (Medical, Prescrption Drug, Dental and Vision)
  • Life Insurance
  • Training and development

Schedule:

  • Monday-Friday 8am-5pm

 

Enterprise Holdings operates the National, Enterprise, and Alamo car rental brands and has frequently been named one of the top places to work.   Enterprise Holdings is the largest and fastest growing privately owned automotive rental and leasing company in North America.  

 

We are committed to maintaining the highest standards of cleanliness in the industry, and as an Auto Detailer and Car Washer you will be at the forefront of our Complete Clean Pledge, going above and beyond our already rigorous cleaning protocols, to protect the health and safety of all.

 

From trucks to vans to cars of all sizes you will be responsible for washing, cleaning, sanitizing, inspecting, and preparing your branch's vehicles in accordance with our Complete Clean Pledge, ensuring that all vehicles rented by our customers are safe and clean.

 

With this in mind, as you are considering a position with Enterprise Holdings, we invite you to learn more about our business. Today â€“ and every day â€“ the safety and wellbeing of employees, customers and the communities we serve is our top priority. For the latest on our COVID-19 response, and for more information on our Complete Clean Pledge,please click here.

 

Responsibilities:
  • Clean and sanitize vehicle interior per Complete Clean Pledge standards
  • Vacuum and prepare vehicle interior per Complete Clean Pledge standards
  • Wash, clean and dry the vehicle's exterior - this might include cars of different sizes, as well as vans and trucks.
  • Check fuel level and warning lights: inspect windshield for damage; factory reset/restore vehicle setting to clear prior customer data; check for customer items and place anything of value in Lost & Found; verify that registration is present, current and matches the license plate.
  • Check fluid levels and add as needed; check tire condition, pressure and tread depth; inspect vehicle exterior for damage
  • Fuel and stage vehicle
  • Inspect vehicle for any safety concerns; report any warning lights and/or vehicle/windshield/tire damage; pull vehicle out of the prep processing as necessary
  • Maintains a clean and orderly work area and report any unsafe or hazardous conditions
  • Responsible for wearing proper personal protection equipment (PPE) and ensuring cleaning, detailing, washing and sanitization supplies are available
  • Assists customers when needed. May transport customers to and from the branches
  • Helps maintain overall site appearance including general cleaning of interior and exteriors of branch locations
  • Site appearance responsibilities to include: desktops, countertops, phones, floors, trash, bathrooms, vacuuming, sweeping the lot and any other miscellaneous tasks related to the daily cleanliness of the branch location
Additional Responsibilities
  • Seek to improve job performance through self-assessment, skill development, training and goal setting
  • Maintain a regular and reliable level of attendance and punctuality
  • Perform miscellaneous job-related duties as assigned
Qualifications:
  • Must be at least 18 years old
  • Must have a valid driver's license with no more than 2 moving violations and/or at-fault accidents on driving record in the past  3 years
  • No drug or alcohol related conviction on driving record in the past 5 years
  • Must be authorized to work in Canada and not require work authorization sponsorship by our company for this position now or in the future.
  • Must be able to lift 25 pounds to assist customers
